poem:
Recognition in the News

An olive branch  
held in trembling hands—  
Canada whispers  
across oceans,  
echoed by the quiet nods  
of old allies.

West Bank's breath  
is held tight,  
while anxious borders  
quake under  
wary feet.  

Europe watches,  
clouded in caution,  
a hesitant dawn  
in fragile walls.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "European officials warn Israel not to annex parts of West Bank in response to recognition of Palestinian state – Middle East crisis live 9.43am BST Canada yesterday became the first G7 (Group of Seven) nation to officially recognise a Palestinian state. The UK quickly followed suit, and France, which has been leading the drive towards recognition, is expected to this week. Germany and Italy, meanwhile, which are also G7 members, have made it clear that". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
